snippet: Suspicious of government initiatives, protesters linked to the Tea Party are denouncing all manner of measures they equate with a 1992 United Nations resolution, Agenda 21.
abstract: Tea Party activists nationwide are railing against all sorts of local and state efforts to control sprawl and conserve energy, branding government projects as part of a United Nations-led conspiracy to deny property rights and herd citizens toward cities; are protesting the expansion of public transportation, bike lanes on public streets and smart meters on home appliances--efforts they equate to a big-government blueprint against individual rights; local officials say these often heated protests are gaining too much traction to be ignored.

byline.original: By LESLIE KAUFMAN and KATE ZERNIKE
byline.contributor: John A. Montgomery contributed reporting from Roanoke, Va.

lead_paragraph: Suspicious of government initiatives, protesters linked to the Tea Party are denouncing all manner of measures they equate with a 1992 United Nations resolution, Agenda 21.

headline.seo: Activists Fight Green Projects, Seeing U.N. Plot
headline.main: Activists Fight Green Projects, Seeing U.N. Plot
headline.print_headline: Activists Fight Green Projects, Seeing U.N. Plot
